Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 1) What is the problem/event that occurred ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: Black specks were observed within the AUTO-INJECTOR trays, identified during the packaging process.

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 2) For this problem/event which is the affected product / products?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: FG PRODUCT-A SOL 40MG/0.8ML SA AUTO-INJECTOR BULK PACK

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 3) For this problem/event which is the affected product batch number / batch numbers?
4) For this problem/event which is the affected equipments (specify equipment codes as well) ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: No specific equipment was identified as the cause of the issue. The issue originates from the tray manufacturing process.

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 5) For this problem/event at what time/date was the problem/event discovered ?
6) For this problem/event at what time/date has the problem/event occurred?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: The issue likely occurred during the tray manufacturing process, before the trays were used for packaging.

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 7) For this problem/event in which department was the problem/event discovered ?
8) For this problem/event in which department has the problem/event occurred?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: Supplier Manufacturing Department (Tray Production at COMPANY-B)
Conducting routine quality checks during packaging.

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 10) The event/problem is a deviation from what ? ( An existing procedure, specifications,etc. ) Provide details of the procedure, specifications, etc.
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: Deviation from material quality specifications for AUTO-INJECTOR trays due to the presence of black specks.

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 12) Who was involved in the incident/problem ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: Packaging Operators, Quality Control Inspectors, Supplier (COMPANY-B) Manufacturing Team

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 13) Where in the process is the problem detected ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: During final product packaging at COMPANY A

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 14) Where else could the incident occur but did not ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: During raw material inspection before use in packaging

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 15) What immediate action/interim control was taken after the event was discovered?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: Operators manually removed black specks where possible. Material was rejected only if specks were deemed excessive. COMPANY A contacted COMPANY-B to investigate.

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 16) Who approved the immediate action/interim control that was taken ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: Quality Assurance Team at COMPANY A

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 17) Who undertook the immediate actions/interim controls that were implemented following this event ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: Packaging Operators under Quality Assurance supervision

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 18) When did immediate actions/interim control take place ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: On 07 January 2025, immediately after the issue was detected

Problem Description and Immediate Action.Q: 19) How will the immediate actions taken contain the spread of the event ?
Problem Description and Immediate Action.A: Ensuring affected trays are identified and either cleaned or rejected if the specks are excessive. Confirming that the issue does not pose a safety risk.

Initial Impact Assessment.Q: 1) Has the deviation been raised within 24 hours of discovering the event ?
2) If the deviation was not raised within 24 hours of finding the problem/event, has any justification been provided ?
3) How often has this event occurred in the past ?
Initial Impact Assessment.A: This is the first reported complaint of this type.
Moderate; visible during routine quality checks.

Initial Impact Assessment.Q: 5) Is there any impact on patient safety ? Please provide justification.
Initial Impact Assessment.A: No. The black specks are confirmed as charred polymer particles from the extrusion process and do not pose contamination risks.

Initial Impact Assessment.Q: 6) Is there any impact on product quality ? Please provide justification.
Initial Impact Assessment.A: No impact on the functionality of the AUTO-INJECTOR. It is a minor cosmetic issue.

Initial Impact Assessment.Q: 7) Is this event related to Data Integrity ?
8) Is there any impact to the global procedure of the company ?
9) Is any customer quality agreement impacted by this deviation ?

Initial Impact Assessment.A: No, as the issue is confirmed to be minor and does not impact patient safety or product efficacy.

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.Q: 1) Who are the cross-functional team members who performed the investigation (Include Name and Function) ?
Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: Quality Assurance Team, Packaging Team, Supplier (COMPANY-B) Technical Team

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.Q: 2) What is the deviation scope ? ( Specify what is included in the scope of the deviation and what is not and why ? Consider and specify Products/Batches/Equipment/Parameters/Documents/People/Time).
Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: Scope includes trays from affected supplier batches used in packaging at COMPANY A. Finished Batch 2136314

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.Q: 3) As a part of investigation plan - Which documents would/have been reviewed (Batch Records, SOPs, Work Instructions, reports, etc. )?
Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: Batch Packaging Record (BPR), Supplier Material Specifications, Work Instruction WI-00164

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.Q: 4) As a part of investigation plan - Which QMS records would/have been reviewed (CAPA, Change Controls, Deviations, Quality Agreements) ?
Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: No previous deviations related to this issue.

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: No additional testing needed as the issue is purely cosmetic.

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: Direct inspection of affected trays. Supplier process review.

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: Black specks were determined to be charred polymer particles, a normal part of the tray extrusion process.

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: Visual inspection, supplier consultation, historical review.

Investigation/Root Cause Analysis.A: No changes in the packaging or supplier process.

Environment.Q: 2) Was there any temperature excursion in the area involved in the process ?

Environment.A: No, humidity levels were within the specified range.

Environment.Q: 5) If Environment is not a possible root cause for this event what is the justification ?
Environment.A: The justification is that no environmental deviations (temperature, humidity, or external factors) were observed during the process.

Root Cause.Q: 1) What are the possible root cause or root causes for this event ?
Root Cause.A: The root cause is material-related, specifically charred polymer particles generated during the tray manufacturing process. The supplier (COMPANY-B) confirmed that these black specks are a result of the extrusion process and are not foreign contaminants. This is a normal occurrence in the tray production process and does not impact product quality or patient safety.

Corrective Action.Q: 1) What corrective action is proposed for the root cause identified for the event ? Itemize the answer(If there are more than 1 corrective actions). Include completion date.
Corrective Action.A: No corrective action is required, as the specks are inherent to the manufacturing process and do not impact safety or product quality. However, operators will continue to manually remove excessive black specks before use to maintain cosmetic quality.

Preventive Action.Q: 1) What is/are the preventive action proposed for the root cause identified for the event ? Itemize the answer (If there are more than 1 preventive actions). Include completion date.
Preventive Action.A: 1. Supplier Engagement -- COMPANY A will engage with COMPANY-B to explore potential improvements in the extrusion process to minimize the occurrence of charred polymer particles. (Completion Date: Ongoing) 2. Material Inspection -- Operators will be instructed to closely inspect trays for excessive black specks and remove trays if required. (Completion Date: Immediate and Ongoing) 3. Supplier Communication -- Future supplier batch inspections will include explicit checks for excessive speck presence. (Completion Date: Ongoing for each supplier batch)

Preventive Action.Q: 2) Any interim controls proposed for the root cause identified for the event ? Include completion date.
Preventive Action.A: Interim Action: Operators will continue manual removal of excessive black specks from trays before use. (Completion Date: Ongoing as part of routine operations)

Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).Q: 1) What is the impact assessment on product quality ? (Include product name, batch number) Please provide detailed justification.
Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).A: Product Name: FG PRODUCT-A SOL 40MG/0.8ML SA AUTO-INJECTOR BULK PACK, Batch Number: 2136314. Impact Justification: The black specks are minor cosmetic imperfections in the trays and do not affect the quality of the final product. The bulk auto-injectors remain compliant with all specifications, and there is no risk of contamination.

Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).Q: 2) What is the impact of this event on a quality system (Include procedure / standard operating procedures) ? Please provide detailed justification
Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).A: Impact Justification: There is no impact on standard operating procedures (SOPs) or work instructions. Work Instruction WI-00164 was followed correctly, and no deviations were noted.

Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).Q: 3) What is the impact of this event on a quality sub-system ?
Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).A: There is no impact on any quality sub-system since the event does not affect the product, manufacturing process, or compliance.

Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).Q: 4) Are any previously manufactured batches impacted by this event ? (Include product name, batch number) Please provide justification.
Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).A: Yes, two supplier batches of trays (Batch 36707 & Batch 36468) were used in multiple work orders. However, no other complaints or deviations have been reported for these batches, so no further action is required.

Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).Q: 5) Are any other related activities previously executed impacted by this event ?
Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).A: No, the issue is specific to cosmetic imperfections in the trays and does not impact previous activities, processes, or product quality.

Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).Q: 6) Are any activities planned in the future impacted by this event ? If yes, what is the CAPA for the same ?
Detailed Impact Assessment (Final).A: No, there are no impacts on future activities, as operators will continue to inspect trays, and supplier engagement will help minimize the occurrence of specks.
